snippet: The two big soda companies, often criticized for producing drinks that are too sugary, will post the figures first in San Antonio and Chicago and later nationwide.
abstract: Pepsico and Coca-Cola are retooling their vending machines to let consumers know the number of calories in the soft drinks available to buy; program will first appear in Chicago and San Antonio in early 2013 and later nationwide.
lead_paragraph: The two big soda companies, often criticized for producing drinks that are too sugary, will post the figures first in San Antonio and Chicago and later nationwide.

headline.main: Pepsi and Coke to Post Calories of Drinks Sold in Vending Machines
headline.print_headline: Pepsi and Coke to Post Calories of Drinks Sold in Vending Machines
